info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:26PM CDT until April 22 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG...NORTHERN RANDALL...WESTERN CARSON AND EASTERN POTTER COUNTIES... At 726 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Amarillo, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported golf ball size hail. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Panhandle, Fritch, Lake Tanglewood, Washburn, Mescalero Park and Pantex. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
